DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to find out the effects of hypoglycemia on cognition in healthy individuals and how well changes in (interstitial) tissue glucose levels correlate with changes in cognitive function as compared to blood glucose levels.
DOC.brief_title: Blood/Interstitial Glucose Measurements and Cognitive Function During Hypoglycemia and Recovery
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects will undergo hypoglycemic clamps during which interstitial glucose will be measured and cognitive function will be assessed.
DOC.criteria: non obese (BMI <30), ages 1850 renal or hepatic failure cancer or lymphoma malabsorption or malnourishment hypercortisolism alcoholism or drug abuse anemia eating disorder or depression coronary artery disease Arrhythmias hypertension on medications known to affect the blood glucose to be measured such as glucocorticoids on blood thinning agents Pregnant women, breastfeeding women and women who want to become pregnant in the next 6 months will be excluded from the study. Subjects who have donated blood two weeks prior to the study. Allergies to pig derived products (Heparin will be used)
